definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
(of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: These masquerade balls became popular in continental Europe in the 17th century.
sentences.chinese: 这种化妆舞会在十七世纪的欧陆颇为盛行。

sentences.english: This weekend, I'm going to a fancy dress ball.
sentences.chinese: 周末我要参加一个化妆舞会。

sentences.english: This is a masked ball, you should conceal yourself.
sentences.chinese: 那可是化妆舞会，你得把自己“藏起来”。

sentences.english: Festival categories of clothing. Makeup applied to Christmas parties and other occasions.
sentences.chinese: 节日类服装，适用于圣诞化妆舞会等场合。

sentences.english: Halloween nis also a time for masquerade parties.
sentences.chinese: 万圣节前夜还是举办化妆舞会的好时机。

sentences.english: Some people dressed up as clowns at the costume party.
sentences.chinese: 一些人在化妆舞会上打扮成小丑模样。

sentences.english: A friend once invited me to a costume party.
sentences.chinese: 有朋友邀请我去参加化妆舞会。

sentences.english: At least it is, but it's for fancy dress.
sentences.chinese: 好吧就算是童装，但那是化妆舞会穿的。

sentences.english: It's similar to going out in a costume at night with a mask on to cover the face (see research on deindividuation).
sentences.chinese: 这就像在晚上头戴面具去参加化妆舞会。

definition: (loanword) party (social gathering)/(Tw) party (typically associated with sex and drugs)
